ingredients: 3-4 tbsp white or yellow miso paste
2 cups greens (spinach, chard, or bok choy), chopped
2 green onions, sliced (white and green parts)
2 sheets nori seaweed, cut into strips
instructions: In a medium pot, bring vegetable broth to a simmer
In a small bowl, whisk miso paste with a few tablespoons of hot broth until smooth
Add tofu cubes and greens to the simmering broth, cook 2-3 minutes
Add green onions and nori strips, cook 1 more minute
Remove pot from heat (important - don't boil miso after adding)
Stir in the miso paste mixture until well combined
Taste and adjust with soy sauce if needed
Serve hot, drizzled with sesame oil if desired

ingredients: 2 apples (any variety - Granny Smith, Honeycrisp, Fuji)
4 oz (120g) cheese (cheddar, gouda, brie, or your favorite)
instructions: Wash apples thoroughly
Core apples and slice into wedges or rounds
Slice cheese into thin pieces or small cubes
Arrange apple slices on a serving plate or board
Place cheese alongside or on top of apple slices
Optional: drizzle with honey
Optional: sprinkle with chopped nuts and cinnamon
Serve immediately for best freshness

ingredients: 1 tbsp miso paste or 1 tsp salt
4 oz (115g) pork belly or chashu, sliced (optional)
Optional: chili oil, corn, bamboo shoots
instructions: Prepare soft-boiled eggs: boil eggs 6.5 minutes, cool in ice water, peel
In a large pot, bring broth to a simmer
Add soy sauce, miso paste (or salt), and 1 tbsp sesame oil
Cook ramen noodles according to package, drain and set aside
In the broth, add mushrooms and cook 2-3 minutes
Divide noodles among serving bowls
Ladle hot broth over noodles
Top with sliced pork (if using), halved soft-boiled eggs
Add bean sprouts, green onions, nori strips
Drizzle with remaining sesame oil and chili oil if desired
Serve immediately while hot

ingredients: Pickled vegetables (pickled carrots, daikon, or cabbage)
Salt and white pepper to taste
Optional: fried shallots, chili oil, cilantro
instructions: Rinse rice until water runs clear
In a large pot, bring broth, water, and ginger to a boil
Add rice, reduce heat to low
Simmer uncovered for 1-1.5 hours, stirring occasionally
Cook until rice breaks down and porridge reaches desired consistency
Add more water if needed for thinner consistency
Season with soy sauce, sesame oil, salt and white pepper
Prepare pickled vegetables on the side
Serve hot porridge garnished with chopped scallions
Serve pickled vegetables on the side
Optional: add fried shallots, chili oil, or cilantro as toppings

ingredients: 1 cup mixed nuts (almonds, walnuts, cashews, pecans)
1 cup mixed dried fruits (raisins, cranberries, apricots, dates)
Optional: dark chocolate chips or chunks
Optional: pumpkin seeds or sunflower seeds
Optional: cinnamon or cardamom for seasoning
instructions: Choose raw or roasted nuts according to preference
If nuts are raw, toast them in a dry pan for 3-5 minutes until fragrant
Let nuts cool completely
Chop large dried fruits (apricots, dates) into bite-sized pieces
Combine nuts and dried fruits in a bowl
Optional: add dark chocolate chips for extra indulgence
Optional: add pumpkin or sunflower seeds for variety
Optional: sprinkle with cinnamon or cardamom
Store in airtight container for up to 2 weeks
Portion into snack-sized bags for easy grabbing

ingredients: 1 cup sour cream or crème fraîche
instructions: Freeze cabbage heads for 2-3 days, then thaw overnight in fridge
Cook rice in boiling water for 5 minutes (al dente), drain
Sauté onion in olive oil until tender, 7-10 minutes
Mix beef, pork, parsley, onions, carrots, rice, salt and pepper
Mix sauce ingredients in a bowl, set aside
Remove cabbage leaves from heads, cut thick ribs
Place 2 tbsp filling at wide end of leaf, fold sides in and roll up
Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C)
Pour some sauce on bottom of casserole dish
Layer cabbage rolls, adding bay leaves and sauce halfway
Pour remaining sauce over rolls, cover
Bake for 1.5-2 hours until tender
Serve with extra sour cream if desired

ingredients: 2 cups milk (dairy, almond, or oat milk)
1/2 cup mixed nuts (walnuts, almonds, pecans), chopped
Fresh berries or sliced banana for topping (optional)
Butter or extra honey for drizzling (optional)
instructions: Combine oats, milk, water, and salt in a medium saucepan
Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally
Reduce heat to low and simmer 5-7 minutes until oats are soft and creamy
Remove from heat, stir in vanilla if using
Stir in honey and cinnamon
Divide oatmeal into serving bowls
Top generously with chopped nuts
Add fresh berries or sliced banana if desired
Drizzle with extra honey or butter if you like
Serve warm

ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (carrots, daikon, cucumber, cauliflower)
instructions: Cut vegetables into sticks or bite-sized pieces
In a saucepan, combine vinegar, water, sugar and salt
Bring to a simmer, stirring until sugar dissolves
Let the pickling liquid cool completely
Place vegetables, garlic, ginger, and chilies in clean glass jars
Pour cooled liquid over vegetables to cover completely
Add fresh herbs if desired
Seal jars and refrigerate for at least 24 hours
Vegetables will keep for 2-3 weeks refrigerated
Serve cold as a snack or side dish

ingredients: 1 lb (450g) chicken breast or thighs, sliced
1 cup Thai eggplant or regular eggplant, cubed
1 tbsp palm sugar or brown sugar
instructions: Heat oil in a wok or large pan over medium-high heat
Add green curry paste, stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until fragrant
Add chicken pieces, stir-fry until browned on outside
Pour in 1/2 can coconut milk, stir to combine
Add fish sauce and sugar, cook 3-4 minutes
Add remaining coconut milk and chicken broth, bring to simmer
Add eggplant and bamboo shoots, cook 5 minutes
Add bell pepper, cook 3-4 more minutes until vegetables are tender
Remove from heat, stir in Thai basil and lime juice
Adjust seasoning with fish sauce or lime juice as needed
Serve hot over jasmine rice

ingredients: 4 slices crusty bread (rye, sourdough or whole grain)
Optional: garlic cloves for rubbing bread
instructions: Heat butter or oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat
Crack eggs into pan, being careful not to break yolks
Season with salt and pepper
Cook until whites are set but yolks are still runny, 3-4 minutes
For over-easy, carefully flip and cook 30 more seconds
Toast bread until golden and crispy
Optional: rub warm bread with cut garlic clove
Place eggs on toast, garnish with fresh herbs if desired
Serve immediately while eggs are hot

ingredients: 4 tbsp natural peanut butter (creamy or chunky)
Optional: chia seeds or granola for topping
instructions: Choose ripe but firm bananas (some brown spots are good)
Peel bananas and slice into rounds or leave whole for dipping
Place peanut butter in a small bowl for dipping or spread on banana slices
Optional: drizzle with honey for extra sweetness
Optional: sprinkle with cinnamon
Optional: top with chia seeds or granola for crunch
Serve immediately for best texture

ingredients: 2 tbsp tamarind paste or 2 tbsp lime juice + 1 tbsp brown sugar
1 tbsp palm sugar or brown sugar
instructions: Soak rice noodles in warm water for 30 minutes until soft, drain
Mix fish sauce, tamarind paste, and sugar in a small bowl, set aside
Heat wok or large pan over high heat, add 1 tbsp oil
Stir-fry garlic and dried shrimp (if using) for 30 seconds
Add shrimp, cook 2-3 minutes until pink, remove from pan and set aside
Add remaining oil to pan, scramble eggs and set aside
Return to high heat, add drained noodles
Pour sauce over noodles, toss to coat evenly
Cook 2-3 minutes, tossing frequently
Add shrimp and eggs back to wok, toss together
Add bean sprouts and green onions, toss 30 seconds
Remove from heat
Serve topped with crushed peanuts and lime wedges
Optional: add chili flakes for heat
